Author: CrisF#3405
Content: FYI, warning about using Graviex in PIRATE channel. `https://discordapp.com/channels/512188534111862784/512188534111862786/593781079945510942` ```Please do not use Graviex for ARRR deposit or withdrawal until they fix their issues with their internal system. In the past few days we received many reports from our pirates, that Graviex has not credited their deposits, or has not sent out withdrawals, claiming they did, but there is "no way to check it." Latter is not true, but we can not help them with their internal system, they received all the technical help they need from us to resolve the issues. Until further notice, refrain using Graviex for trading ARRR.```

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
Just checking - the current transaction fee (default) in LABS is 0.00005 
Can someone point me to the  code or option where the LABS dust level is set??

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Bar_F1sh_Rel what do you mean dust level?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `-minrelaytxfee=<amount in coins>` as a startup param will make your node accept and relay <0.00005 tx fee txes

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: the lowest tx fee is whateve number individual nodes will take

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so `-minrelaytxfee=0.00000001` for 1 sat

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
Not sure if it is the same for KMD and asset chains - but in other zcash derivatives there is a hard-coded mintxfee that sets the dust level
Anything below the dust level is considered to be 'free' (ie the same as setting zero fee) - then there is a limit in kB transactions per block that can have zero fee (and so below dust level).
I can't see ``-minrelaytxfee`` in the LABS startup params - so it has to be hardcoded somewhere?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`a hard-coded mintxfee that sets the dust level`
it's coded as an either/or if/then thing
if not set then use default 
default = whatever is coded
however, you can make it whatever you want

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: Sure - it's the `whatever is coded` that I am interested in as *most* (maybe) node operators can't be bothered or know about it to set it (apart from pool ops that is)

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: <https://github.com/KMDLabs/komodo/blob/master/src/main.h#L87>

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: Thats the one - Cheers.

Content: if your filter shows that there is a notarization tx in every block ever, then your filter is bad

Author: Alright#0419
Content: iguana will not attempt to create a notarization tx until 5 blocks have past

Content: then there is a delay as it's not instantly created

Content: 10 blocks for every coins besides LABS

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: no, all blocks would be a waste of funds

Author: Alright#0419
Content: height % 5, iguana will begin to attempt to create a notarization

Author: phm87#7395
Content: then why all blocks seems notarized on http://35.188.117.96:40268/blocks except the few last ones ?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: height % 10 for everything besides LABS chains

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@phm87 when a block "is notarized", it means either it or atleast one block above it has been checkpointed into KMD/BTC 
every block will eventually be notarised, but on an average 1 in 10 blocks are checkpointed

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
it explains the behavior observed thank you @gcharang 
But then, how dpow can protect a chain to have blocks between 2 notas being reverted (before the second nota of course) ? The incentive for the attacher can seems inexisting (because exchanges checks notarisations and confirmations and no deposit should be accepter on an exchange if there is no nota) except for CHIPS where the funding of a channel does not take into account notarizations
